category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(1)(ii)(A) Risk analysis

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(1)(ii)(B) Risk management
description: Utilize AWS CloudTrail log file validation to check the integrity of CloudTrail logs. Log file validation helps determine if a log file was modified or deleted or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered it. This feature is built using industry standard algorithms: SHA-256 for hashing and SHA-256 with RSA for digital signing. This makes it computationally infeasible to modify, delete or forge CloudTrail log files without detection.

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(1)(ii)(B) Risk management

For example, API permissions are required to decrypt the data before it can be read.

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(4)(ii)(C) Access establishment and modification
description: Ensure that AWS Secrets Manager secrets have been accessed within a specified number of days. The rule is non-compliant if a secret has not been accessed in 'unusedForDays' number of days. The default value is 90 days.
title: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated as per the rotation schedule

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(4)(ii)(C) Access establishment and modification
description: This control checks whether AWS Systems Manager documents that are owned by the account are public. This control fails if SSM documents with the owner Self are public.
title: SSM documents should not be public

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(4)(ii)(C) Access establishment and modification
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring common ports are restricted on AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) security groups.
title: VPC security groups should restrict ingress access on ports 20, 21, 22, 3306, 3389, 4333 from 0.0.0.0/0

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(4)(ii)(C) Access establishment and modification
description: AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) Security Groups can help manage network access by providing stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS resources.
title: VPC security groups should restrict ingress SSH access from 0.0.0.0/0

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(4)(ii)(C) Access establishment and modification
description: Ensure that AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC) subnets are assigned a public IP address. The control is compliant if AWS VPC does not have subnets that are assigned a public IP address. The control is non-compliant if AWS VPC has subnets that are assigned a public IP address.
title: VPC subnet auto assign public IP should be disabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(B) Protection from malicious software
description: An inventory of the software platforms and applications within the organization is possible by managing AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) instances with AWS Systems Manager.
title: EC2 instances should be managed by AWS Systems Manager

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(B) Protection from malicious software
description: Use AWS Systems Manager Associations to help with inventory of software platforms and applications within an organization.
title: SSM managed instance associations should be compliant

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(B) Protection from malicious software
description: Enable this rule to help with identification and documentation of AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) vulnerabilities.
title: SSM managed instance patching should be compliant

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C) Log-in monitoring
description: AWS CloudTrail can help in non-repudiation by recording AWS Management Console actions and API calls. You can identify the users and AWS accounts that called an AWS service, the source IP address where the calls generated, and the timings of the calls. Details of captured data are seen within AWS CloudTrail Record Contents.
title: At least one enabled trail should be present in a region

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C) Log-in monitoring
description: Use AWS CloudWatch to centrally collect and manage log event activity. Inclusion of AWS CloudTrail data provides details of API call activity within your AWS account.
title: CloudTrail trails should be integrated with CloudWatch logs

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C) Log-in monitoring
description: Utilize AWS CloudTrail log file validation to check the integrity of CloudTrail logs. Log file validation helps determine if a log file was modified or deleted or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered it. This feature is built using industry standard algorithms: SHA-256 for hashing and SHA-256 with RSA for digital signing. This makes it computationally infeasible to modify, delete or forge CloudTrail log files without detection.
title: CloudTrail trail log file validation should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C) Log-in monitoring
description: AWS GuardDuty can help to monitor and detect potential cybersecurity events by using threat intelligence feeds.
title: GuardDuty should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C) Log-in monitoring
description: You can do real-time monitoring of API calls by directing CloudTrail logs to CloudWatch Logs and establishing corresponding metric filters and alarms. Security Hub recommends that you create a metric filter and alarm for failed console authentication attempts.
title: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Management Console authentication failures

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(D) Password management
description: The identities and the credentials are issued, managed, and verified based on an organizational IAM password policy.
title: IAM password policies for users should have strong configurations

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(D) Password management
description: The credentials are audited for authorized devices, users, and processes by ensuring IAM access keys are rotated as per organizational policy.

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(D) Password management

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(D) Password management

title: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated within specific number of days

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.308 Administrative Safeguards > 164.308(a)(5)(ii)(D) Password management
description: This rule ensures that AWS Secrets Manager secrets have rotated successfully according to the rotation schedule. Rotating secrets on a regular schedule can shorten the period that a secret is active, and potentially reduce the business impact if it is compromised.

title: RDS DB snapshots should be encrypted at rest

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: Ensure that your AWS Redshift clusters require TLS/SSL encryption to connect to SQL clients.
title: Redshift cluster encryption in transit should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To protect data at rest, ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS Redshift clusters. You must also ensure that required configurations are deployed on AWS Redshift clusters. The audit logging should be enabled to provide information about connections and user activities in the database.
title: Redshift cluster audit logging and encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: Ensure that AWS Redshift clusters are using a specified AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key for encryption. The rule is compliant if encryption is enabled and the cluster is encrypted with the key provided in the kmsKeyArn parameter. The rule is non-compliant if the cluster is not encrypted or encrypted with another key.
title: AWS Redshift clusters should be encrypted with KMS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets.
title: S3 bucket default encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets.
title: S3 bucket default encryption should be enabled with KMS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data in transit, ensure that your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL).
title: S3 buckets should enforce SSL

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) is enabled for your SageMaker endpoint.
title: SageMaker endpoint configuration encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) is enabled for your SageMaker notebook.
title: SageMaker notebook instance encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: Ensure that all secrets in AWS Secrets Manager are encrypted using the AWS managed key (aws/secretsmanager) or a customer managed key that was created in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The rule is compliant if a secret is encrypted using a customer managed key. This rule is non-compliant if a secret is encrypted using aws/secretsmanager.
title: Secrets Manager secrets should be encrypted using CMK

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and decryption
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure that your AWS Simple Notification Service (AWS SNS) topics require encryption using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).
title: SNS topics should be encrypted at rest

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: This control checks whether AWS X-Ray active tracing is enabled for your AWS API Gateway REST API stages.
title: API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: API Gateway logging displays detailed views of users who accessed the API and the way they accessed the API.
title: API Gateway stage logging should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: The Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) health checks for AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) Auto Scaling groups support maintenance of adequate capacity and availability.
title: Auto Scaling groups with a load balancer should use health checks

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS CloudTrail records AWS Management Console actions and API calls. You can identify which users and accounts called AWS, the source IP address from where the calls were made, and when the calls occurred. CloudTrail will deliver log files from all AWS Regions to your S3 bucket if MULTI_REGION_CLOUD_TRAIL_ENABLED is enabled.
title: At least one multi-region AWS CloudTrail should be present in an account

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: The collection of Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) data events helps in detecting any anomalous activity. The details include AWS account information that accessed an AWS S3 bucket, IP address, and time of event.
title: All S3 buckets should log S3 data events in CloudTrail

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS CloudTrail can help in non-repudiation by recording AWS Management Console actions and API calls. You can identify the users and AWS accounts that called an AWS service, the source IP address where the calls generated, and the timings of the calls. Details of captured data are seen within AWS CloudTrail Record Contents.
title: At least one enabled trail should be present in a region

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Use AWS CloudWatch to centrally collect and manage log event activity. Inclusion of AWS CloudTrail data provides details of API call activity within your AWS account.
title: CloudTrail trails should be integrated with CloudWatch logs

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Utilize AWS CloudTrail log file validation to check the integrity of CloudTrail logs. Log file validation helps determine if a log file was modified or deleted or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered it. This feature is built using industry standard algorithms: SHA-256 for hashing and SHA-256 with RSA for digital signing. This makes it computationally infeasible to modify, delete or forge CloudTrail log files without detection.
title: CloudTrail trail log file validation should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Checks if CloudWatch alarms have an action configured for the ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA, or OK state. Optionally checks if any actions match a named ARN. The rule is non-compliant if there is no action specified for the alarm or optional parameter.
title: CloudWatch alarm should have an action configured

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Ensure a minimum duration of event log data is retained for your log groups to help with troubleshooting and forensics investigations.
title: Log group retention period should be at least 365 days

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Enable this rule to help improve AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) instance monitoring on the AWS EC2 console, which displays monitoring graphs with a 1-minute period for the instance.
title: EC2 instance detailed monitoring should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS Elastic Beanstalk enhanced health reporting enables a more rapid response to changes in the health of the underlying infrastructure. These changes could result in a lack of availability of the application. Elastic Beanstalk enhanced health reporting provides a status descriptor to gauge the severity of the identified issues and identify possible causes to investigate.
title: Elastic Beanstalk enhanced health reporting should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Elastic Load Balancing activity is a central point of communication within an environment.
title: ELB application and classic load balancer logging should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Ensure that AWS OpenSearch Service (OpenSearch Service) domains are configured to send logs to AWS CloudWatch Logs. The rule is compliant if a log is enabled for an OpenSearch Service domain. This rule is non-compliant if logging is not configured.
title: Elasticsearch domain should send logs to CloudWatch

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS GuardDuty can help to monitor and detect potential cybersecurity events by using threat intelligence feeds.
title: GuardDuty should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS GuardDuty helps you understand the impact of an incident by classifying findings by severity: low, medium, and high.
title: GuardDuty findings should be archived

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Checks whether the AWS Lambda function is configured with function-level concurrent execution limit. The control is non-compliant if the Lambda function is not configured with function-level concurrent execution limit.
title: Lambda functions concurrent execution limit configured

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Enable this rule to help notify the appropriate personnel through AWS Simple Queue Service (AWS SQS) or AWS Simple Notification Service (AWS SNS) when a function has failed.
title: Lambda functions should be configured with a dead-letter queue

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: Enable AWS Relational Database Service (AWS RDS) to help monitor AWS RDS availability. This provides detailed visibility into the health of your AWS RDS database instances.
title: RDS DB instance and cluster enhanced monitoring should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: To help with logging and monitoring within your environment, ensure AWS Relational Database Service (AWS RDS) logging is enabled.
title: Database logging should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: To protect data at rest, ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS Redshift clusters. You must also ensure that required configurations are deployed on AWS Redshift clusters. The audit logging should be enabled to provide information about connections and user activities in the database.
title: Redshift cluster audit logging and encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) server access logging provides a method to monitor the network for potential cybersecurity events.
title: S3 bucket logging should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: AWS Security Hub helps to monitor unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software. AWS Security Hub aggregates, organizes, and prioritizes the security alerts, or findings, from multiple AWS services.
title: AWS Security Hub should be enabled for an AWS Account

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: The VPC flow logs provide detailed records for information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC.
title: VPC flow logs should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: To help with logging and monitoring within your environment, enable AWS WAF logging on regional and global web ACLs.
title: WAF web ACL logging should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(b) Audit controls
description: To help with logging and monitoring within your environment, enable AWS WAF (V2) logging on regional and global web ACLs.
title: Logging should be enabled on AWS WAFv2 regional and global web access control list (ACLs)

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect sensitive data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS CloudWatch Log Groups.
title: CloudTrail trail logs should be encrypted with KMS CMK

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Utilize AWS CloudTrail log file validation to check the integrity of CloudTrail logs. Log file validation helps determine if a log file was modified or deleted or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered it. This feature is built using industry standard algorithms: SHA-256 for hashing and SHA-256 with RSA for digital signing. This makes it computationally infeasible to modify, delete or forge CloudTrail log files without detection.
title: CloudTrail trail log file validation should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: This control checks whether a DAX cluster is encrypted at rest. Encrypting data at rest reduces the risk of data stored on disk being accessed by a user not authenticated to AWS. The encryption adds another set of access controls to limit the ability of unauthorized users to access to the data. For example, API permissions are required to decrypt the data before it can be read.
title: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters should be encrypted at rest

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS DynamoDB tables. Because sensitive data can exist at rest in these tables, enable encryption at rest to help protect that data.
title: DynamoDB table should have encryption enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Because sensitive data can exist and to help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Elastic Block Store (AWS EBS) volumes.
title: Attached EBS volumes should have encryption enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS Elastic Block Store (AWS EBS) volumes.
title: EBS default encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure that AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service clusters are configured to have Kubernetes secrets encrypted using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) keys.
title: EKS clusters should be configured to have kubernetes secrets encrypted using KMS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure that your Elastic Load Balancers (ELBs) are configured with SSL or HTTPS listeners. Because sensitive data can exist, enable encryption in transit to help protect that data.
title: ELB classic load balancers should only use SSL or HTTPS listeners

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Because sensitive data can exist and to help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Elasticsearch Service (AWS ES) domains.
title: ES domain encryption at rest should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure node-to-node encryption for AWS Elasticsearch Service is enabled. Node-to-node encryption enables TLS 1.2 encryption for all communications within the AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC).
title: Elasticsearch domain node-to-node encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: This control checks whether AWS OpenSearch domains have encryption-at-rest configuration enabled. The check fails if encryption at rest is not enabled.
title: OpenSearch domains should have encryption at rest enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: This control checks whether connections to OpenSearch domains are using HTTPS. The rule is non-compliant if the OpenSearch domain 'EnforceHTTPS' is not 'true' or is 'true' and 'TLSSecurityPolicy' is not in 'tlsPolicies'.
title: OpenSearch domains should use HTTPS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: This control checks if AWS OpenSearch Service nodes are encrypted end to end. The rule is non-compliant if the node-to-node encryption is not enabled on the domain.
title: OpenSearch domains node-to-node encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS Relational Database Service (AWS RDS) instances.
title: RDS DB instance encryption at rest should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure that encryption is enabled for your AWS Relational Database Service (AWS RDS) snapshots.
title: RDS DB snapshots should be encrypted at rest

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: Ensure that your AWS Redshift clusters require TLS/SSL encryption to connect to SQL clients.
title: Redshift cluster encryption in transit should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity

The rule is non-compliant if the cluster is not encrypted or encrypted with another key.
title: AWS Redshift clusters should be encrypted with KMS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets.
title: S3 bucket default encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets.
title: S3 bucket default encryption should be enabled with KMS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: To help protect data in transit, ensure that your AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL).
title: S3 buckets should enforce SSL

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(c)(1) Integrity
description: AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) bucket versioning helps keep multiple variants of an object in the same AWS S3 bucket.
title: S3 bucket versioning should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(d) Person or entity authentication
description: The identities and the credentials are issued, managed, and verified based on an organizational IAM password policy.
title: IAM password policies for users should have strong configurations

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(d) Person or entity authentication
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring hardware MFA is enabled for the root user.
title: IAM root user hardware MFA should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(d) Person or entity authentication
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring MFA is enabled for the root user.
title: IAM root user MFA should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(d) Person or entity authentication
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring that MFA is enabled for all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that have a console password.
title: IAM users with console access should have MFA enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(d) Person or entity authentication
description: Enable this rule to restrict access to resources in the AWS Cloud.
title: IAM user MFA should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure network integrity is protected by ensuring X509 certificates are issued by AWS ACM.
title: ACM certificates should be set to expire within 30 days

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure that a REST API stage uses a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate. This rule is compliant if the REST API stage does not have an associated SSL certificate.
title: API Gateway stage should uses SSL certificate

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: To help protect data at rest, ensure encryption is enabled for your API Gateway stage's cache.
title: API Gateway stage cache encryption at rest should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure that AWS EC2 Auto Scaling groups have public IP addresses enabled through Launch Configurations. This rule is non-compliant if the Launch Configuration for an Auto Scaling group has AssociatePublicIpAddress set to 'true'.
title: Auto Scaling launch config public IP should be disabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: This control checks whether an AWS CloudFront distribution requires viewers to use HTTPS directly or whether it uses redirection. The control fails if ViewerProtocolPolicy is set to allow-all for defaultCacheBehavior or for cacheBehaviors.
title: CloudFront distributions should require encryption in transit

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to the AWS Cloud by ensuring DMS replication instances cannot be publicly accessed.
title: DMS replication instances should not be publicly accessible

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to the AWS Cloud by ensuring EBS snapshots are not publicly restorable.
title: EBS snapshots should not be publicly restorable

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Deploy AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) instances within an AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC) to enable secure communication between an instance and other services within the amazon VPC, without requiring an internet gateway, NAT device, or VPN connection.
title: EC2 instances should be in a VPC

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to the AWS Cloud by ensuring AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) instances cannot be publicly accessed.
title: EC2 instances should not have a public IP address

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure that your Elastic Load Balancers (ELB) are configured to drop http headers.
title: ELB application load balancers should be drop HTTP headers

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: To help protect data in transit, ensure that your Application Load Balancer automatically redirects unencrypted HTTP requests to HTTPS.
title: ELB application load balancers should redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Because sensitive data can exist and to help protect data at transit, ensure encryption is enabled for your Elastic Load Balancing.
title: ELB classic load balancers should use SSL certificates

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure that your Elastic Load Balancers (ELBs) are configured with SSL or HTTPS listeners. Because sensitive data can exist, enable encryption in transit to help protect that data.
title: ELB classic load balancers should only use SSL or HTTPS listeners

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to the AWS Cloud by ensuring AWS EMR cluster master nodes cannot be publicly accessed.
title: EMR cluster master nodes should not have public IP addresses

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to the AWS Cloud by ensuring AWS Elasticsearch Service (AWS ES) Domains are within an AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC).
title: ES domains should be in a VPC

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Ensure node-to-node encryption for AWS Elasticsearch Service is enabled. Node-to-node encryption enables TLS 1.2 encryption for all communications within the AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC).
title: Elasticsearch domain node-to-node encryption should be enabled

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Deploy AWS Lambda functions within an AWS Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC) for a secure communication between a function and other services within the AWS VPC.
title: Lambda functions should be in a VPC

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring AWS Lambda functions cannot be publicly accessed.
title: Lambda functions should restrict public access

description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by only allowing authorized users, processes, and devices access to AWS Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) buckets.
title: S3 buckets should prohibit public write access

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) security groups can help in the management of network access by providing stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS resources.
title: VPC default security group should not allow inbound and outbound traffic

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring common ports are restricted on AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) security groups.

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) Security Groups can help manage network access by providing stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS resources.
title: VPC security groups should restrict ingress SSH access from 0.0.0.0/0

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security
description: Manage access to resources in the AWS Cloud by ensuring common ports are restricted on AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) Security Groups.
title: VPC security groups should restrict ingress TCP and UDP access from 0.0.0.0/0

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(1) Transmission security

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls
description: AWS CloudTrail records AWS Management Console actions and API calls. You can identify which users and accounts called AWS, the source IP address from where the calls were made, and when the calls occurred. CloudTrail will deliver log files from all AWS Regions to your S3 bucket if MULTI_REGION_CLOUD_TRAIL_ENABLED is enabled.
title: At least one multi-region AWS CloudTrail should be present in an account

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls
description: The collection of Simple Storage Service (AWS S3) data events helps in detecting any anomalous activity. The details include AWS account information that accessed an AWS S3 bucket, IP address, and time of event.

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls
description: AWS CloudTrail can help in non-repudiation by recording AWS Management Console actions and API calls. You can identify the users and AWS accounts that called an AWS service, the source IP address where the calls generated, and the timings of the calls. Details of captured data are seen within AWS CloudTrail Record Contents.
title: At least one enabled trail should be present in a region

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.312 Technical Safeguards > 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity controls

category_breadcrumb: HIPAA Final Omnibus Security Rule 2013 > 164.314 Organizational Requirements > 164.314(b)(2) Implementation specifications
description: This control checks whether a DAX cluster is encrypted at rest. Encrypting data at rest reduces the risk of data stored on disk being accessed by a user not authenticated to AWS. description: This control checks whether a DAX cluster is encrypted at rest. Encrypting data at rest reduces the risk of data stored on disk being accessed by a user not authenticated to AWS. The encryption adds another set of access controls to limit the ability of unauthorized users to access to the data. For example, API permissions are required to decrypt the data before it can be read.
title: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters should be encrypted at rest
